trial_identification.studytitle: The Wellbeing Program2: An open trial of a brief internet based treatment of anxiety and depression
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An open trial of a brief Internet based treatment for anxiety and depression

conditions.healthcondition: Panic disorder (with or without agoraphobia) (both anxiety disorders)

interventions.interventions: This is an open trial where participants are allocated to recieve 8 week internet-based treatment. All participants will meet Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders 4th Edition (DSM-IV) criteria for depression, and/or social phobia and/or panic disorder (with or without agoraphobia) and/or generalised anxiety disorder (GAD). All participants will complete 5 lessons of Internet based treatment about management of symptoms of depression and anxiety. One lesson will be completed every 7 to 10 days. Each lesson will take about 15 minutes to complete. Participants will also have access to summaries of each lesson, and will read anonymous stories about other people with anxiety, taking a further 20 minutes per summary. All participants will also receive automatic email and weekly reminder phone calls by a clinical psychologist. The duration of the reminder emails/phone calls and contribution to the forum is expected to be 5-10 minutes per week. The duration of the program is 8 weeks, but participants will be contacted 3 months post program and asked to complete follow-up questionnaires. Study questionnaires will be administered at application, pre-education, post-education, and at 3-months post-education. These will take about 20-30 minutes to complete. The treatment materials are based on the Anxiety and Sadness Programs, which apply cognitive behavioural techniques.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Anxiety is measured by the Generalised Anxiety Disorder 7 Item Scale (GAD-7)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

primaryOutcome.outcome: Social phobia is measured by the Social Phobia Scale (SPS)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

primaryOutcome.outcome: Social phobia is measured by the Social Interaction Anxiety Scale (SIAS)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Neuroticism is measured by using the NEO-Five Factor Inventory (NEO-FFI) Neuroticism scale
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Disability is measured by the Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Psychological distress is measured by the Kessler 10-item scale (K-10)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Panic disorder is measured by the Panic Disorder Severity Rating Scale - Self Report Version (PDSS-SR)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Generalised anxiety disorder is measured by the Penn State Worry Questionnaire (PSWQ)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Symptoms and severity of depression is measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at pre-treatment, post-treatment, and at 3-months post-treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: -Meet DSM-IV criteria for major depressive disorder, social phobia and/or panic disorder (with or without agoraphobia) and/or GAD - Internet access + printer access - Australian resident - Males and females
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - Current substance abuse/dependence - Psychotic disorder - Current or planned psychological treatment during study duration - Change in medications during last 1 month or intended change during study duration - Current use of benzodiazepines or beta-blockers.

trial_design.concealment: Participants apply online, followed by a telephone interview to confirm diagnosis via structured diagnostic interview using the Mini Neuropsychiatric Interview Schedule (MINI 5.0.0).

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This project is part of a research program funded by the NHMRC (No. 630560) to develop and evaluate Internet based transdiagnostic treatment programs for people with anxiety and depression. This preliminary project examines the efficacy of a treatment program for people with depression, social phobia and/or panic disorder (with or without agoraphobia) and/or GAD. The purpose of this study is to see if a brief internet-based intervention is effective at reducing levels fo anxiety and depression.
